title: pytorch-cpu installs cudnn and cudatoolkit when using conda
body_html:
Hi, when I install pytorch for CPU usage via conda (conda install -c soumith pytorch-cpu) it downloads and installs cudnn and cudatoolkit, which seems to be unnecessary for installation for a CPU version not using cuda. This is especially a problem when building docker images since I would like to keep them as light as possible. I cannot think of how that could be, but does the CPU version have any dependencies on cudnn and cudatoolkit? If not can these dependencies be removed for the cpu version?
Not sure if this is the correct place to bring this up. If not, happy to be pointed in the right direction.
